result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 10:40am
Defendant Brandon T. Bach not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Prelim-Waiver today, however it is just being learned that Mr. Bach was transferred in the past few days to DCI.  The hearing is rescheduled.

[ae] case called 11:18 AM Defendant Brandon T. Bach appeared by telephone in custody from Rock County Jail. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $750 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Sidney KRANIG
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:25 am
